channel.title: Math for Machines
channel.description: A blog about data science and machine learning, with a lot of math.

item.title: A TFRecords Tutorial
item.description:
Over on Kaggle, I wrote a couple of tutorials for working with TFRecords, a binary file format typically used for distributed training in TensorFlow. Of interest if you want to use TPUs for training neural networks.

  • TFRecords Basics and accompanying video with Jesse Mostipak
  • Walkthrough: Building a Dataset of TFRecords
item.dc:creator: Ryan Holbrook

item.title: Getting Started with TPUs on Kaggle
item.description:
Petals to the Metal is Kaggleâ€™s newest Getting Started competition, highlighting Tensor Processing Units. A TPU is an accelerator developed by Google especially for machine learning. They can be used in TensorFlow much like GPUs, and are quite powerful. I had the pleasure of writing a tutorial to go along with the competition. Check it out!

Getting Started with TPUs
item.dc:creator: Ryan Holbrook
